%text $A$ is a $3\times 3$ matrix we use as an example to understand how to determine the Cofactor Matrix % \begin{align} A=\left[\begin{array}{ccc} a_1 & a_2 & a_3 \\ b_1 & b_2 & b_3 \\ c_1 & c_2 & c_3 \end{array}\right] \end{align} \\ %text Each element in the matrix, has a minor $(M_{ij})$, which is the Determinant of the submatrix remaining when the row $(i)$ and column $(j)$ containing that element are removed from the original matrix. For e.g., % \begin{align} M_{11}&=(b_2c_3-c_2b_3) \\ M_{21}&=(a_2c_3-c_2a_3) \\ M_{31}&=(a_2b_3-b_2a_3) \\ ...& \\ M_{33}&=(a_1b_2-b_1a_2) \\ \end{align} \\
%text The final cofactor $(CF_{ij})$ for each minor is obtained by multiplying it by $(-1)^\text{i+j}$, % \begin{align} CF_{11}&=(b_2c_3-c_2b_3)(-1)^{1+1}=b_2c_3-c_2b_3 \\ CF_{21}&=(a_2c_3-c_2a_3)(-1)^{2+1}=c_2a_3-a_2c_3 \\ ...& \\ CF_{33}&=(a_1b_2-b_1a_2)(-1)^{3+3}=a_1b_2-b_1a_2 \\ \end{align} \\ %text The Cofactor Matrix looks like this, % \begin{align} CF&=\left[\begin{array}{ccc} b_2c_3-c_2b_3 & c_1b_3-b_1c_3 & b_1c_2-c_1b_2 \\ c_2a_3-a_2c_3 & a_1c_3-c_1a_3 & c_1a_2-a_1c_2 \\ a_2b_3-b_2a_3 & b_1a_3-a_1b_3 & a_1b_2-b_1a_2 \end{array}\right] \end{align} \\
